title: Common English Vocabulary Words that Start with K

json.text: Welcome to PnT English channel. A learning vocabulary with videos channel.
Welcome to the oxford 3000 essential words program. Now, let's start learning English!
Section 11: Words Starting with K. k. k . k. k is the eleventh letter of the
English alphabet. It is also a written abbreviation of kilometre or kilometres. A metric unit
of length equal to 1000 meters (or 0.621371 miles). About twenty kilometres from the border.
keen. k . e . e . n . keen. keen means having or demonstrating ability to recognize or draw
fine distinctions. An keen observer of politics and politicians.
keen on. keen on. keen on means wanting to do something or wanting something to happen
very much. I wasn't too keen on going to the party.
keep. k . e . e . p . keep. keep means keep in a certain state, position, or activity.
The students keep me on my toes. key. k . e . y . key. key means metal device
shaped in such a way that when it is inserted into the appropriate lock the lock's mechanism
can be rotated. There's a special key for winding up this clock.
keyboard. k . e . y . b . o . a . r . d . keyboard. keyboard means device consisting of a set
of keys on a piano or organ or typewriter or typesetting machine or computer or the
like. A computer keyboard. kick. k . i . c . k . kick. kick means strike
with the foot. The boy kicked the dog. kid. k . i . d . kid. kid means a young person
of either sex. They're just kids. kill. k . i . l . l . kill. kill means cause
to die; put to death, usually intentionally or knowingly. This man killed several people
when he tried to rob a bank. killing. k . i . l . l . i . n . g . killing.
killing means an event that causes someone to die. A series of gangland killings.
kilogram. k . i . l . o . g . r . a . m . kilogram. kilogram means one thousand grams; the basic
unit of mass adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites. A kilogram is approximately 2.2
pounds. kilometer. k . i . l . o . m . e . t . e . r
. kilometer. kilometer meansÂ a metric unit of length equal to 1000 meters. The fire destroyed
some 40,000 square kilometres of forest. kind. k . i . n . d . kind. kind means a category
of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality. What kinds of desserts are there?
kindly. k . i . n . d . l . y . kindly. kindly means showing or motivated by sympathy and
understanding and generosity. He has kindly agreed to let us use his barn for the dance.
unkind. u . n . k . i . n . d . unkind. unkind means lacking kindness. A thoughtless and
unkind remark. kindness. k . i . n . d . n . e . s . s . kindness.
kindness means the quality of being warmhearted and considerate and humane and sympathetic.
I can never repay your many kindnesses to me.
king. k . i . n . g . king. king means a male sovereign; ruler of a kingdom. The kings and
queens of England . kiss. k . i . s . s . kiss. kiss means touch
with the lips or press the lips as an expression of love, greeting, etc. The newly married
couple kissed. kitchne. k . i . t . c . h . n . e . kitchne.
kitchne means a room equipped for preparing meals. She's in the kitchen.
km. k . m . km. km means km is a written abbreviation for kilometre. The fire destroyed some 40,000
square kilometres of forest. knee. k . n . e . e . knee. knee means hinge
joint in the human leg connecting the tibia and fibula with the femur and protected in
front by the patella. I grazed my knee when I fell.
knife. k . n . i . f . e . knife. knife means edge tool used as a cutting instrument; has
a pointed blade with a sharp edge and a handle. Rifles exploded quick knives of fire into
the dark. knock. k . n . o . c . k . knock. knock means
deliver a sharp blow or push. rap with the knuckles. Knock on the door.
knot. k . n . o . t . knot. knot means a tight cluster of people or things. A small knot
of women listened to his sermon. know. k . n . o . w . know. know means be
cognizant or aware of a fact or a specific piece of information. I want to know who is
winning the game! unknown. u . n . k . n . o . w . n . unknown.
unknown means an unknown and unexplored region. They came like angels out the unknown.
well known. well known. well known means widely or fully known. A politician who is well known.
knowledge. k . n . o . w . l . e . d . g . e . knowledge. knowledge means the psychological
result of perception and learning and reasoning. He has a wide knowledge of painting and music.
Thanks for watching! This is all for section 11: Words starting with K. You can move on
to section 12 : Words starting with L. We'll see you next time. Goodbye!
